medical_history.chief_complaint: Reactivation of phantom limb pain following cervical myelopathy surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced neck and back pain preoperatively. After surgery, he developed pain in his left upper arm that extended to the elbow, wrist, and fingers throughout the day. By night, the pain intensified and was recognized as similar to the previous phantom limb pain. This pain was intractable, continuous, and exacerbated by shoulder movement or pressure applied to the stump.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous amputation below the left shoulder and below the right knee due to a railway accident; chronic pain requiring long-term opioid therapy; phantom limb pain episodes for approximately 15 years, transitioning to numbness prior to the recent surgery.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has a history of heavy alcohol consumption and smoking (30-pack/year).
